question: [December 2024] Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland has resigned, harshly criticizing Prime Minister Trudeau. Trudeau is facing increasing pressure from within his own party. What is your main message to Canadians at this moment?

answers.answer: I will call for the immediate resignation of Prime Minister Trudeau and for fresh elections. We have a strong Conservative team that is ready to take on the many crises facing our country.
answers.feedback: The unity of your party stands in contrast to the chaos in the Liberal Party.

answers.answer: The Liberals are trying to push Trudeau out not because they disagree with anything he did, but because he is toxic to Canadians. Never forget: these are the same old Liberals who supported Trudeau’s toxic agenda for the last decade. It’s time to turn the page!

question: [January 2025] Trudeau has announced his resignation as Prime Minister and prorogued Parliament while the Liberals hold their leadership election. Mark Carney is the frontrunner among the Liberal leadership contenders. Now is your chance to define him to Canadians. What will be your main message?

answer.answer: Carbon Tax Carney, he’s just like Justin. He’s always supported carbon taxes. He even called Trudeau’s carbon tax a model for others. Whatever he says, he will keep making you pay.
answer.feedback: Carney ends up ending the consumer carbon tax on April 1st, and Canadians see the prices at the pump drop.

answer.answer: Carney is just visiting. He was in the United States for many years as a banker with Goldman Sachs. Then he went off to England. He even called himself a European! He’s not in it for you.
answer.feedback: This attack would be more effective if Carney hadn’t spent a significant part of his career in Canada, from deputy finance minister to central bank head to chairman at Brookfield.

answer.answer: Carney is in it for himself. When he became adviser to Trudeau, he solicited $10 billion of your taxpayer money to give to Brookfield. He has used his positions of influence to enrich himself at the expense of everyday people.
answer.feedback: This both ties Carney to Trudeau and associates him with corruption.

answer.answer: Mark Carney is a creature of the elite. He has close ties with the big banks and the globalist institutions trying to uproot your way of life. He’s looking out for the interests of the rich and powerful, not the little guy.
answer.feedback: The liberal media deride you for your conspiracism, but the common man hears you too!

question: [January 2025] United States President Donald Trump has floated the idea of Canada becoming the 51st American state. What do you make of it?

answer.answer: I will take any action and accept any level of damage to preserve our sovereignty.
answer.feedback: These are fighting words, and ones that Canadians like.

answer.answer: Canada will never be the 51st state. Period. We are a great and independent country, and we are their best friend.
answer.feedback: This balances being firm and diplomatic.

answer.answer: After a lost Liberal decade, Canada is broken. A closer union between the US and Canada would make us both stronger.
answer.feedback: Patriotic Canadians are furious that you are unwilling to reject Trump’s suggestions.

answer.answer: The President is just joking around. We need to be focusing on real issues, not fearmongering over imagined threats.
answer.feedback: Canadians want a Prime Minister who will stand up for the country.

question: [January 2025] There are suggestions from CSIS that China and India are interfering in Canadian politics. You have the option to gain top secret security clearance and be informed of these threats. Do you take it?

answer.answer: I will refuse. The security clearance process involves intrusive questions on personal and family information. I don’t trust these Liberals who will do anything to hold on to power, and they could use the information they get for political purposes.
answer.feedback: This line of reasoning makes people wonder what you have to hide.

answer.answer: The Liberals are trying to muzzle me. As a condition of receiving these briefings, I would be gagged. I refuse to have my ability to speak freely be impeded, and I will use that freedom to attack the Liberals for being beholden to China.
answer.feedback: The other party leaders have acquired security clearance, and they have also attacked Carney on national security issues, making many question whether the concerns over being gagged is the real reason for your refusal.

answer.answer: I will accept the offer and gain security clearance. All the other party leaders have already undergone this process. I want Canadians to be confident that I take national security seriously, and that I have nothing to hide.
answer.feedback: You are briefed on the Chinese and Indian interference, and you remove a potential avenue on which you could have been attacked.

question: [February 2025] President Trump has announced 25% tariffs on all Canadian products, which he justifies by claiming Canadian border enforcement is allowing “mass numbers of people to come in and fentanyl to come in”. How do you respond?

answer.answer: These tariffs wouldn’t be happening if not for Trudeau’s mismanagement. We will have a strong border and a strong relationship with the United States.
answer.feedback: Trump ends up hitting most of the world with tariffs. Canadians don’t believe his justifications about the border.

answer.answer: I will take a Team Canada approach. Whatever our political differences, we must stand together against Trump’s tariffs and threats to our sovereignty, whatever the cost.
answer.feedback: This satisfies many who were concerned about your willingness to stand up to Trump.

answer.answer: We must address President Trump’s concerns about the border. We need to take back control of our border to tackle illegal immigration and drugs. I will convince Trump that it is in his interest to keep the border open for trade.
answer.feedback: Canadians want retaliation for these economic threats.

answer.answer: Trump won’t just be coming after us and Mexico, he will target the whole world. I will lead a coalition of like-minded countries to have a unified response and a strong negotiating position.
answer.feedback: This internationalism is appealing to many, but your base wants you to put Canada first.

question: [March 2025] Mark Carney has won the Liberal leadership and been sworn in as the 24th Prime Minister of Canada. He moves quickly to abolish the consumer carbon tax and reverse a recent increase in the capital gains tax. The political landscape is being turned upside down, and some polls show his Liberals leading your Conservatives.

answer.answer: The race is on!
answer.feedback: Let’s bring it home!

question: [March 2025] You have long been characterized as an “attack dog” by the media, with some saying this makes you unsuited to governance. How will you handle your personal image?

answer.answer: I will continue with my current approach. Canadians want a fighter who is willing to tell it how it is. I will be that fighter.
answer.feedback: It has worked well so far. If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it?

answer.answer: I need to be seen as a statesman. I will dial back my aggressive tone and let others tear into my opponents.
answer.feedback: This may broaden your appeal, but some people notice that you look a bit deflated.

answer.answer: I want to focus on energy and dynamism. I will bring new ideas and a new approach to governance, contrasting with the same old Liberal politics that got us into this mess.
answer.feedback: It’s a good idea in theory, but you lack the charisma to pull it off convincingly.

answer.answer: I make myself more relatable. I will mingle more with real Canadians and show my human side.
answer.feedback: Some people make fun of you for some of your interactions, but the people you meet with are glad to have someone willing to listen to them.

question: [March 2025] The left-wing NDP which previously supported the Trudeau government is facing strong headwinds as Carney enters the race. How will you target them?

answer.answer: The woke NDP has abandoned workers in favour of pushing radical gender ideology.
answer.feedback: Conservative working class voters cheer you on while the liberal media write op-eds lambasting your anti-woke bent.

answer.answer: I will ignore the NDP. This election is between me and Carney.
answer.feedback: No harm, no foul.

answer.answer: At least the NDP tries to appeal to workers. By contrast, Mark Carney is fully a creature of the elites with deep ties to the World Economic Forum and the Century Initiative. Screwing working people comes naturally to him.
answer.feedback: You’ve spent so long demonizing the NDP that it takes some convincing to believe Carney is even worse.

answer.answer: I will attack Jagmeet Singh and the NDP for propping up Justin Trudeau for so long. They are also responsible for the mess Canada is in right now.
answer.feedback: This attack sticks, and some previous NDP supporters disappointed in Trudeau reconsider their options.

question: [March 2025] Prime Minister Carney announces a snap election for April 28th. As the campaign starts, what will be your main theme?

answer.answer: After a lost Liberal decade of weak economic growth, unaffordable housing, and rising crime, we need a change. Carney pretends to be an outsider, but he was Trudeau’s economic advisor, and his team is made up of the same people. We cannot afford a fourth term of failed radical Liberal policies.
answer.feedback: You campaign for change, and the people hear you.

answer.answer: I will fight the woke ideology that has infected so much of society including the public service, university research, and the military. The woke agenda has gone too far and must be stopped.
answer.feedback: Your supporters cheer you on, but your opponents draw comparisons between you and Donald Trump.

answer.answer: I will stand up to Trump. I stood up to Trudeau when he hurt Canadian jobs, and I will stand up to Trump as he does the same. Meanwhile, Carney was helping Trudeau and moving his company’s headquarters to Trump’s America.
answer.feedback: Centering your opposition to Trump gets you some mainstream approval, but your base seems less energized.

answer.answer: Everywhere you look, there are gatekeepers standing in the way of hard-working men and women. I will fire the gatekeepers, unleashing Canadian innovation and entrepreneurship to make our country the envy of the world.
answer.feedback: This populist appeal rallies your followers to your economic reform agenda.

question: [March 2025] Slogans are an important part of any campaign, and you have plenty of them. What will you centre as your primary slogan for this election?

answer.answer: Protect Canada. People are worried about the state of the world and the threats to our country. I will do everything in my power to protect our country.
answer.feedback: This reassures those worried about Canadian sovereignty.

answer.answer: Canada First. I will be making it clear that I will put our country first for a change.
answer.feedback: Your critics go after you for using a slogan that evokes Trump’s own America First messaging.

answer.answer: Canada is Broken. After a decade of Liberal weakness, our country is falling apart. I will make us strong again.
answer.feedback: This rings true for many Canadians, but isn’t it just a bit too negative?

answer.answer: Common Sense Change. I will emphasize the need for change, and that my proposals are common sense.
answer.feedback: This appeals to a wide range of voters.

question: [March 2025] Where will you focus your resources at the beginning of this campaign?

answer.answer: British Columbia. We have a good shot of gaining ground in places like Nanaimo and Surrey.
Nova Scotia. Tim Houston recently won a massive victory there, but our support seems to be slipping there.
Alberta. We need to lock down the big cities and build back some momentum.
Northern Ontario. This is a good chance to finally flip some of those remote communities to the Conservative column.

question: [March 2025] There are several conservative provincial premiers across the country, will you be seeking their support?

answer.answer: I am running my own campaign. I will accept any endorsements from current or former Premiers, but I won’t go begging to them.
answer.feedback: You get endorsements from Danielle Smith and Scott Moe, but Doug Ford, and Tim Houston hold their silence.

answer.answer: I will do everything I can to win over Doug Ford, including giving him input on my campaign and public promises of financial support for major projects in Ontario.
answer.feedback: Doug Ford still declines to endorse, but he says some nice things about you and ensures no one in his camp speaks out against you.

answer.answer: I will appeal to the premiers in private to avoid any statements that could be construed as favouring Trump. We need message discipline if we are to end this disastrous Liberal government.
answer.feedback: The premiers more favourable to Trump toe your line and avoid throwing a wrench into your campaign.

answer.answer: I will seek the endorsements of Danielle Smith and Scott Moe, two stalwarts of the West. I will hit the campaign trail with them and rally our supporters.
answer.feedback: Your unity with the two Western premiers energizes your base, but be aware they are both less popular than you both nationally and provincially.

question: [March 2025] Québec has a distinct French Canadian identity and has significant representation in the House of Commons. What will be your approach towards Québec?

answer.answer: I will respect Québec’s right to defend its culture, and I will not intervene in any provincial competencies without provincial buy-in.
answer.feedback: You avoid alienating Québec voters, but you still face tough competition from the Liberals and Bloc Québécois.

answer.answer: We need Québec to win. I will promise them everything, including extra funds for infrastructure, veto power over new pipelines in Québec, cultural protection, and full control over immigration.
answer.feedback: Your Prairie base sees this as a betrayal. This does help you in Québec, however.

answer.answer: Not only will I protect Québec’s distinct cultural identity, I will bring a similar national pride to the rest of Canada and fight against woke ideology. We should expect immigrants to speak an official language and adopt our values.
answer.feedback: Selling your conservative policies as Québec-inspired gives you some inroads among potential supporters in Québec.

answer.answer: Québec is a lost cause. I will pull campaign funds from the province, and I won’t hold back from criticizing equalization payments and pushing for pipelines.
answer.feedback: Your Prairie base cheers you on!

question: [March 2025] What will be your approach to media appearances during your campaign?

answer.answer: The biased mainstream media will never give me a fair hearing. I will focus on big rallies and get my message out on friendly alternative media and social media.
answer.feedback: Carney ends up ending the consumer carbon tax on April 1st, and Canadians see the prices at the pump drop.

answer.answer: I will run a serious campaign. That means giving the standard interviews to mainstream media, but also directing messaging towards my supporters through new media.
answer.feedback: You satisfy the mainstream while energizing your base.

answer.answer: I will meet Canadians where they are. I will do interviews with mainstream outlets, alternative media, and more lighthearted comedy and cultural shows.
answer.feedback: Appearing in non-political media helps broaden your audience, despite some embarrassing moments.

answer.answer: I will go on any platform that will have me, except right-wing alternative media outlets. I cannot feed the Liberal narrative that I’m some sort of extremist.
answer.feedback: Alternative right-wing media feel slighted, and some in your base fear a pivot.

question: [March 2025] At a press event, a reporter asks you whether you respect Donald Trump. What do you say?

answer.answer: I respect the office of the President of the United States, and I believe that we can be both respectful and firm. I will insist he recognize our sovereignty and drop his tariffs.
answer.feedback: Canadians want you to take a tougher stance against Trump.

answer.answer: Respect is a two-way street. If Trump continues to disrespect Canada, then he does not deserve our respect. If he gives us the respect we deserve, then we can achieve great things together.
answer.feedback: This balances standing up for Canada while remaining cordial with Trump which may be useful in future negotiations.

answer.answer: Not at all. We’re talking about a man who is threatening the livelihoods of Canadians. I cannot respect that.
answer.feedback: You’re standing up to Trump, and Canadians cheer you on. This might complicate trade negotiations, however.

answer.answer: I respect Donald Trump as a leader who is doing everything he can to fight for his people. I will fight for Canadians and win us the best deals.
answer.feedback: The Trump comparisons don’t stop.

question: [March 2025] Nearly 30% of Canadian workers are unionized. What will be your message on labour unions?

answer.answer: I will win over the private sector unions to my side. I will show up for them and bring home more training halls, direct grants and faster EI to apprentices in the licensed trades.
answer.feedback: Many labour unions endorse your campaign and your fight for blue-collar workers.

answer.answer: Union bosses are gatekeepers who are preventing people from working. I will introduce right-to-work legislation that will get rid of these gatekeepers.
answer.feedback: This would weaken labour unions, and they come out in full force against you. This is popular among your base, however.

answer.answer: Public sector unions use economic terrorism to milk you of your tax dollars. I will ban strikes in critical sectors to prevent them from holding the public hostage.
answer.feedback: Your harsh language does you no favors with government workers, but your base cheers you on.

answer.answer: I will attack the Liberals and the NDP for their woke ideology. They have abandoned workers, and union workers will see that I’m the only one fighting for them.
answer.feedback: This appeals to some, but others want to hear solutions.

question: [March 2025] Crime is on the minds of many voters, as the murder rate has increased over the last decade. What is your approach to crime?

answer.answer: I will clear our streets of the scum destroying our communities. I will bring back the death penalty for serial violent criminals along with tougher sentences across the board. Any foreign citizen convicted of a crime will be deported without exceptions.
answer.feedback: The woke mob attacks you for your unconstitutional proposals. But what do they know? The energy at your rallies is palpable.

answer.answer: After a decade of soft on crime, hug-a-thug, catch-and-release policies, we have crime raging out of control. I will keep criminals locked up using the notwithstanding clause if necessary. I say “three strikes and you’re out”: serious repeat offenders are a danger to their communities and must be locked up.
answer.feedback: This is what your supporters want to hear.

answer.answer: We need to clamp down on crime using every tool we have. I will boost funding for police, toughen prison sentences, strengthen border enforcement, and reinforce gun control.
answer.feedback: Your base was with you until you mentioned gun control.

answer.answer: I will attack both the perpetrators and the causes of crime. We need stronger law enforcement and longer prison sentences, but also more community organizations to prevent youth from becoming criminals.
answer.feedback: You strike a moderate path that, for your base, shows too much sympathy to potential criminals.

question: [March 2025] Healthcare is always a major issue in Canadian elections. What will be your message on healthcare?

answer.answer: I will make clear that I will maintain health transfers to the provinces and all existing healthcare programs. Beyond that, I will focus on cost-of-living and economic issues.
answer.feedback: This satisfies most, and you move the discussion to more favourable ground.

answer.answer: Government gatekeepers have been stifling innovation in healthcare. I will fire the gatekeepers to make healthcare faster and better for you and your family.
answer.feedback: This is light on details, and the Liberals accuse you of wanting to privatize healthcare.

answer.answer: Trudeau’s mismanagement of healthcare has left the Canadian system in a dire state. I will eliminate his wasteful bureaucratic programs and put the money into ensuring that you can have timely access to a doctor and treatment.
answer.feedback: This sounds like you intend on cancelling dentalcare and pharmacare. The millions of Canadians who use these programs are worried about losing their benefits.

answer.answer: I will end the bureaucratic madness that is preventing foreign-trained and interprovincial doctors and nurses from practicing medicine.
answer.feedback: This is a mainstream position also supported by Carney (if you remove the incendiary language).

question: [March 2025] The number of people working for the federal government bureaucracy has surged in recent years. What will you say on the issue?

answer.answer: The Liberals have gone on a spending spree at the taxpayer’s expense. I will make deep cuts to the bloated government bureaucracy. This can be done by not replacing people who are leaving the public service.
answer.feedback: The Liberals fearmonger about your proposed public service cuts. Let them whine!

answer.answer: I will loudly deny that there will be any public service layoffs. My focus will be on putting mechanisms in place to ensure the work gets done, because right now the work isn’t getting done.
answer.feedback: Public servants welcome your reassurances, but your base is disappointed.

answer.answer: Worst of all, the Liberals have been handing out contracts to their cronies for exorbitant fees when the work could be done by civil servants already on the government payroll. I will eliminate this wasteful practice.
answer.feedback: This worries contractors, but public servants breathe a sign of relief that they are not the first on the chopping block.

answer.answer: The bureaucracy has grown so much because the Liberals keep adding frivolous programs. I will streamline the government and eliminate unnecessary programs.
answer.feedback: The liberal media deride you for your conspiracism, but the common man hears you too!

question: [April 2025] Do you have any plans for any tax cuts?

answer.answer: In light of the tariff threats for the US, we need to spur Canadian investment now more than ever. I will cut taxes on businesses and investments to bring home jobs and innovation.
answer.feedback: Economists applaud your sound judgement.

answer.answer: We need a massive patriotic tax cut. I will cut income tax by 15% for the average Canadian, dropping the tax rate on the lowest income tax bracket from 15% to 12.75%.
answer.feedback: This is what your supporters want to hear.

answer.answer: Canada is suffering from intolerably high taxes after a decade of failed Liberal government. We need to cut taxes across the board to boost investment and give people a break.
answer.feedback: Your supporters and businesses alike are excited by your plans.

answer.answer: Irresponsible Liberal spending has left the budget in a dire state. I can’t promise any tax cuts right now, we need to fix the budget first.
answer.feedback: Your supporters are disappointed. Surely you can cut irresponsible spending and return it as tax cuts?

question: [April 2025] You have targeted the Liberal government over the unaffordability of housing. What is your housing plan?

answer.answer: I will get rid of the gatekeepers that are preventing housing from being built. That means getting rid of the Housing Accelerator Fund, cutting funding to cities that fail to increase building by 15% per year, and selling off public land. Using the savings from these measures, I will remove GST on new homes.
answer.feedback: These are concrete measures that draw support. However, some are concerned your reforms will reward municipalities that have so far refused to build anything.

answer.answer: Liberal meddling has made homes unaffordable for you and destroyed communities. I will repeal every single housing-related law they have instituted. They aren’t working.
answer.feedback: Many are concerned this will make housing even more expensive. People want to hear solutions.

answer.answer: The reason that homes are so expensive is because greedy government bureaucrats have put outrageous taxes on them. I will immediately remove all federal taxes on homes and withhold infrastructure funding from provinces and municipalities that tax homes excessively.
answer.feedback: Tax cuts are always popular. However, some people are worried that most of the benefit will go to developers, not home-buyers.

answer.answer: We need to free the housing market. Government is the problem. Liberal gatekeepers are preventing private capital from making sound investments in housing stock. I will rail against zoning regulations and rent control as they prevent the market from operating efficiently.
answer.feedback: Ideological free-marketeers are wholeheartedly behind you. Others see this as a giveaway to developers and harmful to the character of their neighbourhoods.

question: [April 2025] Immigration has hit record levels in recent years. How will you manage the immigration system?

answer.answer: Our immigration system was the envy of the world before the Liberals broke it. I will fix the system, and get us back to reasonable immigration levels.
answer.feedback: Concerns about immigration levels are fairly recent, and this meets people where they’re at.

answer.answer: Legal immigrants have nothing to fear from me. I will crack down on illegal immigration and fraudulent asylum seekers. We are a nation of laws, and I will ensure those laws are enforced.
answer.feedback: Your supporters want the law enforced, but they want fewer legal immigrants too.

answer.answer: The Liberals are destroying our country with open borders and allowing criminals to roam free. I will take back control of our borders, deport illegals, and halt immigration while we fix the system.
answer.feedback: Halting immigration entirely goes a step too far for most. The Trump comparisons continue.

answer.answer: We need to ensure that immigrants are net contributors to society. I will prioritize bringing in more doctors and engineers while refusing those who are using up our social housing and food banks.
answer.feedback: Prioritizing economic migrants over refugees and family reunification is a standard Conservative plank. This does not address the concerns that immigration levels are too high in general, however.

question: [April 2025] As we pass the midpoint of the election campaign, where will you focus your efforts?

answer.answer: Southwestern Ontario. We can pick up some seats in Windsor and London.
Ottawa and Kitchener. I will secure my own seat in Carleton and seek to make gains.
Brampton. Making gains here is crucial if we want to form government.
Vancouver. Breaking through in Richmond and Coquitlam could make the difference.

question: [April 2025] Oil and gas is a major Canadian industry. What are your plans for Canadian oil?

answer.answer: I will focus on expanding oil exports.  We need to reduce our reliance on American importers and focus on building pipelines to the coasts for shipping to international markets.
answer.feedback: This is a mainstream answer, but your supporters want more.

answer.answer: I will immediately repeal Bill C-69, the No New Pipelines Law. I will scrap the energy cap. I will axe the industrial carbon tax. I will slash costly red tape. I will listen to our energy producers and unleash our economy.
answer.feedback: This is what your supporters want to hear.

answer.answer: The oil industry is highly productive and profitable, but it must stand on its own two feet. I will repeal the Liberals’ stifling regulations and end subsidies. I will criticize the Liberals spending $50 billion on the Trans Mountain pipeline as a poor use of public money.
answer.feedback: You’re leaning into a libertarian approach which has very little popular support. Your base wants you to back oil!

answer.answer: We need to balance expanding oil production with environmental responsibility. I will take measures to reduce emissions in the oil sector and provide the world with clean oil.
answer.feedback: Your supporters are shocked at your capitulation to the green lobby!

question: [April 2025] What do you say to Indigenous communities that may oppose oil projects in their area?

answer.answer: I will ignore them. For too long, Canadian economic development has been constrained by special interests and gatekeepers. I will get them out of the way, and get Canada building!
answer.feedback: Oil workers are glad you stand with them, but Indigenous communities are outraged, and these plans will face legal challenges.

answer.answer: Most Indigenous people support these projects because they bring jobs and wealth to their communities. I will put First Nations back in control of their money by allowing a portion of federal corporate taxes to be paid to local First Nations.
answer.feedback: You’re dodging the question, but you do outline how you could get projects going without getting into legal fights.

answer.answer: I will respect the rights of Indigenous people. I will respect the duty to consult, and work collaboratively with companies and First Nations to negotiate agreements where everyone wins.
answer.feedback: Indigenous people are satisfied with this, but oil producers worry you will allow First Nations to hold them hostage.

answer.answer: Indigenous communities are receiving a record amount of subsidies under this irresponsible Liberal government. I will condition that aid on their cooperation on issues of economic development.
answer.feedback: You’re picking a fight with First Nations and are denounced by woke elites, but the oil worker is satisfied.

question: [April 2025] Abortion is a touchy issue within your party, with roughly half of you MPs espousing pro-life and pro-choice views. How will you address it?

answer.answer: A Conservative government will not introduce any legislation on abortion.
answer.feedback: You face criticisms from both the Campaign Life Coalition and the Abortion Rights Coalition, but this might be your best option to avoid making it a bigger issue.

answer.answer: I am pro-choice, and I will go further: any Conservative politician who tables a bill against abortion rights will be removed from the party.
answer.feedback: This goes a bridge too far for pro-life conservatives. Some jump ship to the People’s Party.

answer.answer: Canada has the most radical abortionist policy in the world. I will ban live birth abortions and prevent infanticide.
answer.feedback: This makes abortion rights into a central campaign issue, as Canadians worry about American-style abortion bans.

answer.answer: I respect the right to abortion, but taxpayers should not be expected to pay for it. I will end federal funding for abortions.
answer.feedback: The Abortion Rights Coalition goes to war with you, and the liberal media needles you endlessly for what they consider an attack on women’s rights.

question: [April 2025] The opioid crisis continues to hit Canadian communities hard, with thousands of deaths last year. How will you handle this crisis?

answer.answer: I will eliminate the scourge of drugs flooding our streets. We need to be looking to countries like Singapore as an example of what to do with drug users and dealers.
answer.feedback: Your base likes your tough stance, but others want a more compassionate approach to addicts.

answer.answer: I will end safe supply, impose harsh penalties for drug dealers, and use compassionate intervention to get addicts off drugs.
answer.feedback: This is what your supporters want to hear.

answer.answer: I will fire the gatekeepers that tell people what they can and can’t do with their own bodies. Police should focus on tackling violent crime. We don’t need a nanny state.
answer.feedback: This libertarian stance is out-of-touch with the Conservative base.

answer.answer: I will take back control of our borders and prevent hard drugs like fentanyl from entering our country.
answer.feedback: Fentanyl is so prevalent because it is easy to smuggle. Your supporters want to hear more about what else you will do.

question: [April 2025] Some say that your campaign is having difficulty among women. What will be your message to win women over?

answer.answer: I will expand the rights of women by tackling the criminality that victimizes women. Too many violent men are released under this Liberal government, allowing them to reoffend and target women. I will keep these men locked up to protect women from violence.
answer.feedback: Women worried about violence appreciate your focus on the issue.

answer.answer: I will work with the provinces to expand medical coverage to include in-vitro fertilization. Every woman should have the option to have children if she wants them.
answer.feedback: This is a concrete measure that prospective parents are glad you’re on board with.

answer.answer: I will fight against the Liberal runaway housing costs for the couples whose biological clocks are running out faster than they can afford to buy a home and have kids.
answer.feedback: Housing is a major issue for young prospective families, but your use of the “biological clocks” turns some people off.

answer.answer: I will make it possible for women to stay home and care for their children instead of needing to put them in childcare to make ends meet. Instead of subsidizing childcare, I will give the money directly to families, providing a refundable tax credit of up to $6000 per child.
answer.feedback: Traditionalist conservatives support this push, but this doesn’t help women more concerned with the cost of childcare.

question: [April 2025] The death toll in Gaza mounts as Israel continues its occupation. What is your position on the conflict?

answer.answer: It is outrageous that the Liberals have provided funding for UNRWA which is full of Hamas terrorists. I will defund UNRWA and lock up and deport all the anti-semitic rioters who are bringing violence to our streets.
answer.feedback: The Jewish community is thankful for your support.

answer.answer: Israel has a right to defend itself. They are a close Canadian ally, and I will do everything in my power to strengthen that relationship. I will loudly criticize the Liberals for their arms embargo.
answer.feedback: Supporters of Israel are happy to have your backing, though popular support for Israel continues to drop.

answer.answer: Liberal hypocrisy knows no bounds. They are willing to accept that Canada is responsible for a genocide of our proud First Nations, yet are unable to recognize it when tens of thousands lay dead in Palestine!
answer.feedback: Are you calling Israel’s actions in Palestine a genocide? Your supporters are bewildered by your statement.

answer.answer: I will avoid talking about this as much as possible. It is a distraction from economic failures of the Liberal government.
answer.feedback: Your pro-Israel supporters question your silence.

question: [April 2025] You have previously called for the defunding of the CBC. Do you still hold that position?

answer.answer: I will defund the CBC. The government should not be in the business of funding the news media.
answer.feedback: In a moment of Canadian patriotism, taking a hatchet to national institutions is frowned at.

answer.answer: I will defund the CBC but maintain support for Radio-Canada. This is necessary to continue to support the French language and defend French Canadian culture.
answer.feedback: This middle ground leaves people disappointed on both sides.

answer.answer: I will drop my calls to defund the CBC, but the network still needs reform. I will make structural reforms to make it more responsible and impartial.
answer.feedback: This is a pivot that disappoints your base, but your new position is more palatable to the average Canadian.

answer.answer: I will defund the biased CBC and use the savings to fund the journalism of real truth-tellers.
answer.feedback: The biased liberal media is up in arms! But your friends in alternative media show their appreciation.

question: [April 2025] You have talked about reining in government spending. Will that include cuts to foreign aid?

answer.answer: It is outrageous that the Liberal government spends so much money supporting foreign dictators while housing is unaffordable, crime is rampant, and the price of food is skyrocketing. I will eliminate all foreign aid and put Canadians first.
answer.feedback: The Laurentian elite throw a fit, but families struggling to pay the bills hear you too.

answer.answer: Yes, I will slash foreign aid and use that money to secure the Arctic. It’s time to put Canada first, for a change.
answer.feedback: In these dangerous times, cutting aid to fund the military seems sensible to most.

answer.answer: The Liberals have either been corrupt or grossly incompetent in their handling of foreign aid. I will strip out their woke, wasteful programs while preserving aid that actually goes to people in need.
answer.feedback: Your supporters cheer on your attacks on government waste.

answer.answer: In these increasingly dangerous times, Canada has an opportunity to lead the world. I will use foreign aid as a tool to expand our markets and pull countries away from dictatorships like Russia and China.
answer.feedback: This is a very ambitious agenda, but most of your supporters want you to bring that money home.

question: [April 2025] Two official leaders’ debates are held, one in French and one in English. What is your strategy going into the debates?

answer.answer: I will skip the debates. With Carney, Singh, and Blanchet all in attendance, I would be unfairly outnumbered. Not to mention the biased moderators would not give me a fair shake.
answer.feedback: Skipping out on the debate makes you appear unserious to voters.

answer.answer: Carney wants you to think he’s an outsider, but he spent the last five years advising Trudeau on the economy which is now weaker than ever before. He’s making the exact same broken promises as Trudeau on home building. We cannot afford a fourth Liberal term repeating the same failed policies.
answer.feedback: You keep tying Carney to Trudeau, and you come out a narrow winner of the debate.

answer.answer: I will hammer home that Carney cannot be trusted. He has flipped his positions on everything. He has used his positions of influence to enrich himself and his accomplices. He is closely tied with the Century Initiative and the World Economic Forum. Mr. Carney is not a businessman, he is a political grifter.
answer.feedback: Carney hits back that you have never had any of the responsibilities that he has had. Canadians still trust Carney by-and-large, but you are moving the needle.

answer.answer: I will be a statesman and demonstrate my command of the issues. I will communicate my detailed plans for the country, and point out the flaws in Carney’s plans.
answer.feedback: The debate ends up being rather technical, and no one comes out as a clear winner.

question: [April 2025] For the final week of campaigning, where will be your focus?

answer.answer: Broadly across the country. We can win this!
Mississauga. We will be well-positioned if we can flip this part of the Greater Toronto Area.
Québec City. I will rally the proud Québécois to my side!
Hamilton and Niagara Falls. The Golden Horseshoe will bring it home!

question: [April 2025] Stephen Harper was the longest serving Conservative Prime Minister since John A. Macdonald, appointed Mark Carney as Governor of the Bank of Canada, and worked with him throughout the Great Financial Crisis. Will you be seeking Harper’s endorsement?

answer.answer: I want to tie myself as closely as possible to Harper. I will solicit his endorsement and appear at campaign events with him. I will make clear that Harper chooses me, not Carney.
answer.feedback: Harper accepts, and his support bolsters your campaign.

answer.answer: I will accept his endorsement, but I won’t make too much noise about it. I am my own man.
answer.feedback: Harper may not have been that popular when he left office, but he does benefit from significant nostalgia especially among fiscal conservatives.

answer.answer: While I appreciate Harper as a statesman, I have significant differences from him and will avoid associating with him.
answer.feedback: Many Harper supporters are now considering supporting Carney. This doesn’t help to win them over.

question: [April 2025] It’s two days before election day, and a deadly attack on a Filipino street festival in Vancouver has left 11 dead and dozens injured. How do you react?

answer.answer: I will visit a Filipino community church and offer my condolences to the victims and their families.
answer.feedback: This is a standard, non-political response to a tragedy like this.

answer.answer: I will call for expanding gun ownership. This tragedy could have been prevented if people were armed to take out the perpetrator.
answer.feedback: You’re politicizing a tragedy in support of a policy opposed by most voters. Not a good look.

answer.answer: This is a symptom of how broken our country has become under this woke Liberal government. They’ve gone soft and cannot protect you and your family.
answer.feedback: Politicizing a tragedy like this is not a good look.

answer.answer: The culprit was known to police. He should have been locked up to keep our communities safe.
answer.feedback: He was also never previously charged with any crime. Your comment draws the ire of civil rights groups.

question: [April 2025] As the campaign closes, what will be your central message to Canadians?

answer.answer: Do you really think that a fourth Liberal term will change anything? Are we really going to give these clowns a fourth term? We need a change.
answer.feedback: The Liberals’ record is a sore point for Carney. Keep hammering this and swing voters will surely reconsider their support for the Liberals, right?

answer.answer: We need to put Canada first for a change with a new Conservative government to axe taxes, reward work, unleash entrepreneurs, harvest our resources, make things here, secure our borders, rebuild our military, honour our history, and raise our flag. Let’s bring it home!
answer.feedback: A broad, positive message to close out on. Your supporters are energized and eager to vote.

answer.answer: I want to reassure moderates that I am not radical. I will unite the country by bringing back the Canadian promise. It doesn’t matter where you come from, it matters where you’re going. If you work hard, you deserve a great life, whether your family has been here for six generations or you have been here for six weeks.
answer.feedback: You’re making a broad, inoffensive appeal without reference to policy details. This might be what you need to win.

answer.answer: Carney will keep Canadian oil, minerals, and other resources in the ground, keep the anti-development Bill C-69, and keep Canada hostage to the Americans. He will continue the failed radical policies that have made Canada weak.
answer.feedback: You’re ending on a very negative note. Your base is energized for fear of all the things you listed.
